title: Synthetic Recap
body:
ATLANTA – On a night that belonged to one man, the final, decisive shot belonged to someone else. Mookie Blaylock’s 18-foot jumper as time expired gave the Atlanta Hawks a thrilling 105-103 victory over the Phoenix Suns, but the evening’s thunder was stolen by a performance for the ages from Hawks guard Steve Smith.

Smith was simply unstoppable, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 43 points on a scintillating array of shots. He was surgical from beyond the arc, connecting on five three-pointers, and ruthless in his attacks on the basket. Every time the Suns threatened to close the gap, it was Smith who answered, his scoring barrage a constant reminder that history was being written on the Atlanta floor.

The Suns, led by Kevin Johnson’s 25 points and 9 assists, fought valiantly to keep pace. A late push even saw them tie the game at 103-103 in the final seconds, setting the stage for a dramatic finish. But with the clock ticking down, the ball found its way to Blaylock, who calmly rose and buried the game-winner, sending The Omni into a frenzy.

Yet, even as his teammates mobbed him for the winning shot, the headline was already written. Blaylock’s heroics provided the final period, but the story was Smith’s masterpiece—a 43-point explosion that carved its name into the Hawks' record books and delivered a win Atlanta would not soon forget.
